intro: Oreodaphne cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oreodaphne, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical rainforests.
